channel.title: American Thinker
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site, subject to copyright and fair use.

item.title: Before the Gosnell Blackout, There Was Tiller's
item.description: ...and Carhart's, and Allred's, and Patterson's, and Biskind's, and Rotem's, and...

item.title: Maryland's Second Amendment Nightmare: Coming Soon to a State Near You?
item.description: Conservatives in red states would be very unwise to think that they're safe from the encroachments now plaguing the so-called "Free State."

item.title: Are We Being Compromised by Barack Obama's Murky Past?
item.description: Among all the foreign intelligence agencies, Russian intelligence (SVR) has a long history and has made a science of studying the backgrounds of American presidents. They almost certainly know more than we do about our president.

item.title: How Barack Obama Is Using Health Care to Balkanize America
item.description: And what we can do about it.

item.title: Gun Control Derangement Syndrome
item.description: Congress goes down the rabbit hole with the Toomey/Manchin gun-control bill.

item.title: The Rising Price of Civilization
item.description: Latter-day lawmakers never seem to remember that this nation was founded by a bloody revolution caused, in part, by unreasonable taxation.

item.title: Do Left-Wing Professors Really 'Proselytize' on Campus?
item.description: The real story, from someone who's been there a few decades.

item.title: Boola, Boola, Save Your Moolah
item.description: The universities may be intent on diving headfirst into oblivion, but there's no reason why alumni ought to follow them.

item.title: Truth in Fables: Why Progressives Hate Aesop
item.description: Better to read library regulations, say pushers of Common Core.

item.title: How to Bring Middle East Peace and Stability
item.description: Every administration from President Carter to the present has failed to come to grips with the fact that Iran is at war with us.

item.title: 'Last Men' and Atheists
item.description: Arguing with atheists ia largely a waste of time -- though it does help clarify the thinking.

item.title: The Muslims with No Name: Islamists Cover Up Their Existence in the Media
item.description: The AP has revised its definition of "Islamist"...to mean next to nothing at all. CAIR rejoices.

item.title: Does an Attack on Iran mean an Attack on South Korea?
item.description: The unseen currents roiling Korean waters may run deeper than anyone has so far guessed.

item.title: In the Shadow of Lady Liberty
item.description: On a pleasant day in Liberty Park, intrepid New Yorkers oppose illegal non-citizens (supported by the SEIU) trying to claim citizen legitimacy.

item.title: Choosing Life in Israel: a Review
item.description: A personal account of how it feels to be an Israeli citizen living on the front lines of the Middle East.

item.title: King Abdullah II: The Other Elephant in the Room
item.description: The head of the Palestinian Authority and the King of Jordan have entered into an alliance.

item.title: Thomas Jefferson and School Choice
item.description: The man whose proudest work was establishing the University of Virginia would have approved of school choice.

item.title: Obama's Sittin' on the Dock of the Bay
item.description: If we had a foreign policy, it would defend America, and scare tin pot dictators like Kim Jong Un. While Kim arms and menaces, he sits on top of the DMZ. And our Commander-in-Chief is sittin' on the dock of the bay, wastin' time.

item.title: Dangerous Times: How to tell Conservatives from Fascists
item.description: The left's dependence on the "racist" card is well known. But we can't overlook the "crypto-fascist" card.

item.title: Working Up to Auschwitz
item.description: A demon has been revealed in twenty-first-century Philadelphia. The implications for our country are stark.

item.title: Bill Gates Is Too Trusting
item.description: How else can we explain his failed foray into education?

item.title: Why Liberals support Gun Control
item.description: The liberal nanny state is not based on a liberal desire to improve the lives of others; it's based on liberals desire to be nannies -- that is, to run the lives of others.

item.title: Confronting the Bullies
item.description: The problem of school bullying has been far too politicized. Could controlling school bullies be easier than we think?

item.title: Taking it Local
item.description: Breakfast with the folks provides a valuable lesson on how to make politics matter.

item.title: Remembering Why Jackie Robinson Is a Hero
item.description: Al Sharpton could use a refresher.
